If you answered ÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½yesÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ for at least one of these questions, then this game is no doubt for you!

The game seems to be a bit weird at the beginning, when compared to other contemporary games. You have to create your own warriors. You can choose between magician, barbarian, monk, ranger woman (archer woman, forest guard). We plan to enhance the number of choices in the near future. Each of these characters has its own, unique skills and features - you can find more information on this topic in the instruction. Each warrior has personal characteristics (as in the most games); you can form the warrior, its skills and effectiveness by giving points to the selected features.

Beside deciding about the characteristics of a Scriptarian you need to program it. The program is responsible for the behaviour of the hero during the battle, its coordination, who and how it is going to attack, whom it can speak with. As itÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½s been said in the beginning, Scriptarian programs are written in Scriptarin. This language has been specially designed for FRS and Artifex Mundi purposes.
